summary: This document is a chain of FBI internal emails from October 2020 coordinating agent assistance for a scheduled review of digital discovery evidence by Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense attorneys at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The emails discuss scheduling logistics and agent availability.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; her defense team is scheduled to review discovery items, including a laptop and hard drive, at MDC.

events.title: Scheduled discovery review at MDC
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and her attorneys were scheduled to review discovery items, including digital evidence on a laptop and hard drive, at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

events.title: Rescheduled discovery review at MDC
events.description: Defense attorneys requested to view the laptop and hard drive again from 11am to 2pm at MDC, requiring FBI agent assistance.

keyFacts: The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) was actively managing discovery review for the Ghislaine Maxwell case in October 2020.
Maxwell's defense team requested to review digital discovery evidence, specifically a laptop and hard drive, at the Metropolitan Detention Center where she was held.
The review sessions required FBI agents to be present to assist and secure the evidence, indicating the sensitivity of the materials.
Scheduling was complex, with the event being 'scheduled and rescheduled multiple times due to the availability of defense counsel.'
The correspondence shows operational coordination within the FBI New York Field Office to support the legal process in the Maxwell investigation.
